apply_fft1.m

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 %%
00002 %! @file
00003 % Apply Fast Fourier transform to the Radon image
00004 %
00005 
00006 %%
00007 %! Apply FFT to each columns of the matrix, then shifts the DC to the DFT centre. The value of omega_s in each row is defined by the formula omega_s = x * (2*pi / dx) where dx=1.
00008 % @param Radon Radon image. Number of rows must be the power of 2 for FFT to work.
00009 % @param DEBUG Debug mode. Save the Fourier_Radon image in real part and imaginary part.
00010 % @retval Fourier_Radon Radon image in Fourier Space
00011 % @retval omega_s value of omega_s in each row
00012 function [Fourier_Radon omega_s] = apply_fft1(Radon,DEBUG)
00013 
00014 % Apply FFT to each column of the radon image
00015 Fourier_Radon = fft(Radon);
00016 
00017 % Label the omega_s,theta axes;
00018 dx=1;
00019 [size_omega_s size_theta] = size(Fourier_Radon);
00020 omega_s = [0:(size_omega_s/2-1)  (-size_omega_s/2):-1] * 2*pi/dx;
00021 
00022 % Shift the DC to the DFT centre
00023 omega_s = fftshift(omega_s);
00024 Fourier_Radon = fftshift(Fourier_Radon,1);
00025 
00026 if(DEBUG)
00027 THETA = 1:size_theta; %we do not need to know the angles in this function
00028 
00029 save_image(THETA,omega_s, real(Fourier_Radon),...
00030         'Fourier transform of Radon Space, Real Part',...
00031         'theta_i','omega_s');   % Save the radon image (real part)
00032 save_image(THETA,omega_s, imag(Fourier_Radon),...
00033         'Fourier transform of Radon Space, Imaginary Part',...
00034         'theta_i','omega_s');   % Save the radon image (imaginary part)
00035 
00036 stem(omega_s, abs(Fourier_Radon(:,1)));
00037 axis tight;
00038 title('Slice at angle theta=0 in Fourier Space')
00039 xlabel('omega_s'),ylabel('Absolute Value');             % save the slice at 0deg
00040 print -dpng Slice_at_angle_theta_0_in_Fourier_Space.png
00041 end
00042
